snippet: A federal panel will implement dozens of changes in Los Angeles County’s troubled jails in an agreement reached a year after guards were charged with beating prisoners.
abstract: Class-action lawsuit filed by inmates in 2013 citing violence and extreme cruelty by guards in Los Angeles County jail system leads to creation of three-person federal court-appointed panel that will oversee new policies; panel faces daunting challenge of overcoming decades-old culture of brutality that enabled sheriff's deputies, who acted as guards, to regularly beat, punch, kick and shame prisoners.
lead_paragraph: A federal panel will implement dozens of changes in Los Angeles County’s troubled jails in an agreement reached a year after guards were charged with beating prisoners.

headline.main: Panel to Set Terms to End Abusive Reign at Los Angeles County Jail System
headline.print_headline: Panel to Set Terms to End Abusive Reign at Jail System
